# Introduction to Quarto

## Markdown {{< fa brands-markdown >}}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
-   Easy to use
-   "WYSIWYG" editor
-   Content and formatting are integrated instead of seperated
-   Can be an **alternative to using `.docx` files**
-   Used by text editors, GitHub (README), message tools...
-   Integrated in Rstudio as "R Markdown"
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### E.g.: [HedgeDoc:](https://pad.uni-hamburg.de/5DfbDxjNS_isWT8_S0S-2w)

<iframe src="https://hedgedoc.org" width="100%" height="500px">

</iframe>
:::
:::

## What is Quarto?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Publishing System by Rstudio

-   Based on R Markdown (= R Markdown with even more even features)
-   Able to execute code
-   Supports multiple programming languages
-   Integrated in Rstudio
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Usecases

-   [Articles/Reports](https://quarto-dev.github.io/quarto-gallery/page-layout/tufte.html)
-   [Websites](https://nasa-openscapes.github.io)
-   **Presentations**
-   ["Books"](https://lennartwittkuhn.com/version-control-book/)
:::
:::
:::

## Getting started with Quarto

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### How can you work with Quarto?

-   **Rstudio**
-   Jupyter
-   Neovim
-   VS Code
-   Text editor
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Creating a Quarto file

1.  Download and Install [the newest version of Rstudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)
2.  Open R Studio
3.  Create a new .qmd file through: New file -\> Quarto Document
:::
:::
:::

| *italics* and **bold**        |                               |
| ```                           |                               |
+-------------------------------+-------------------------------+
| ```                           | superscript^2^ / subscript~2~ |
| superscript^2^ / subscript~2~ |                               |
| ```                           |                               |
+-------------------------------+-------------------------------+
| ```                           | ~~strikethrough~~             |
| ~~strikethrough~~             |                               |
| ```                           |                               |
+-------------------------------+-------------------------------+
| ```                           | `verbatim code`               |
| `verbatim code`               |                               |
| ```                           |                               |

# Code chunks

## Code chunks

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
-   Quarto files can include pieces of code, which will be executed by rendering the file
-   Code chunks can be interactive
-   You can specify various options for code chunks
-   The code can be as complicated as you want it to be
-   You can also use *inline code*
-   R code enclosed by ```` ```{r} code  ``` ````
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Examples

##### Input

```{r output=FALSE}
#| label: code-example

x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
y <- c(2, 4, 1, 3, 5)
plot(x, y, main = "Scatter Plot Example", xlab = "X-Axis", ylab = "Y-Axis")
```
:::

::: fragment
##### Output

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=TRUE}
x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
y <- c(2, 4, 1, 3, 5)
plot(x, y, main = "Scatter Plot Example", xlab = "X-Axis", ylab = "Y-Axis")
```
:::
:::
:::

## YAML header

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
-   ***Y**AML **A**inÂ´t **M**arkup **L**anguage*
-   Sets up document settings using YAML arguments
-   E.g. title, author, *output format*
-   Can also be used to set up custom theme for styling
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Examples

``` yaml
---
title: "Document title"
author: "Your Name"
execute:
  echo: false
format: pdf
--- 
```
:::

::: fragment
``` yaml
---
title: "{{< var title >}}"
subtitle: |
  {{< var subtitle >}}
  
  [{{< fa display >}} Slides]({{< var website >}}) |
  [{{< fa brands github >}} Source]({{< var source >}})
  
  {{< var license-badge >}}
  {{< var doi-badge >}}
date: today
---
```
:::
:::
:::

Sources: [RStudio - Markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html), [Dr. Monwinckels - Quartaki - 6 hour introduction ro Quarto](https://drmowinckels.github.io/quartaki/)

# Extra features

## Referencing

-   You can name objects like figures, tables...
-   E.g. like this: @sec-citations (`@sec-citations`)

| Type         | Label Prefix |
|--------------|--------------|
| Figures      | fig-         |
| Tables       | tbl-         |
| Equations    | eq-          |
| Sections     | sec-         |
| Code listing | lst-         |
| Theorem      | thm-         |

::: footer
Sources: [RStudio - Markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html), [Dr. Monwinckels - Quartaki - 6 hour introduction ro Quarto](https://drmowinckels.github.io/quartaki/)
:::

## Citations {#sec-citations}

-   Can be added via `insert -> citation`
-   Can also be added directly with `@`
-   Are stored in bibtex files in your project

+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| Markdown Format                              | Output (author-date format)                                  |
+==============================================+==============================================================+
| ```                                          | Blip blop bloop [see @biswal2010, pp. 33-35; also , chap. 1] |
| Blip blop bloop [see @biswal2010, pp. 33-35; |                                                              |
| also @ggseg, chap. 1]                        |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | Blip blop bloop [@biswal2010, pp. 33-35, 38-39 and passim]   |
| Blip blop bloop [@biswal2010, pp. 33-35,     |                                                              |
| 38-39 and passim]                            |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | Blip blop bloop [@ggseg; @biswal2010].                       |
| Blip blop bloop [@ggseg; @biswal2010].       |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | Mowinckel says blah [-@ggseg]                                |
| Mowinckel says blah [-@ggseg]                |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | @biswal2010 says bloop.                                      |
| @biswal2010 says bloop.                      |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+

::: footer
Sources: [RStudio - Markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html), [Dr. Monwinckels - Quartaki - 6 hour introduction ro Quarto](https://drmowinckels.github.io/quartaki/)
:::

# Git integration

## Using Git with `.qmd` files

### Features

-   Plain textfiles so e.g. `git diff` works perfect!
-   Rstudio also has GUI integration of Git

### `.gitignore file`

-   Should include rendered files like `.pdf`
-   When using Rstudio also files like `.Rproj` or `.RData`
